events.title: Software Developer
events.description: Mostly here i have used **Java** & **Swing** for and ABM POS Software also here i developed an Android App published to PlayStore that saves contacts by scanning a QR (VCard) - Qontacto

events.title: Software Developer
description: Here i learned the most of my carreer path, since it was only me & my boss (also a good friend), Some of the stacks & techs we used
**GPS Tracking Client Android App:** [ Kotlin, Java, C++, Google Play Console ]
**ServerSide Apps (GPS Tracking):** J2EE -> Spring + RabbitMQ, **AWS EC2, IoT, DynamoDB, ElasticBeanstalk**, NodeJS, MySQL, Nginx
**Scripting for Monitoring & Releasing:** Git Hooks, GH Actions, Python, Bash, Cron
**Reverse Engineering**: ByteCode decompiling & rewrite, Api discovery

events.title: Software Developer Freelance
description: Meantime i was working on-site, i tried to offer my dev services as a Freelance
**Python webscraping**: Firsts jobs were scraping ecommerces like Amazon/eBay using Python scrapy, i didn't like it so much, but it was easy and highly demmanded

**Remote access for Android devices through a backoffice**: After that i managed to start working with a client regularly by creating a silent background (API <26) to have remote access (like shell) with extra commands like getting location, mic-audio in real time, mic-audio offline, backoffice (& serverside app) was in NodeJS hosted on DigitalOcean Cloud
**Directional WiFi Scanner**: Also as a hobby of the previous client we did with ESP8266 - **Arduino** a servo controlled directional antennas to point at the better signal gain
**Traccar Clients Setup from Android** : Android app using Firebase Auth + Push Messaging to configure Traccar Android Client Apps (location senders)

events.title: SSr. IT Engineer
description: Currently here! And its my first time in a big company, also at the time im writing this its been a year and a half

Techs are so many and info is overwhelming, since i started here i just captured the best SE practices of previous langs & frameworks, even learn new ones like **Go** (Great lang by the way) also in the university is started playing with iOS dev (**swift**, **objC**) although wasn't much i applied some of that in here & of course the usage of great tools like **NewRelic**, **Datadog**
**& even all that i realized the many things i left to know**
